TopicTitle: List of places and biomes in KSP (planetary geology & geography) - UPDATING FOR v1.0.x.

Articles.Content: So... Did anyone check how things are in v23.5? I think lots of things have changed. I'll be happy to update the first post, but I don't feel like checking all that in KSP myself.
I don't think any new biomes were added or altitude layers were changed in 0.23.5, IIRC

This Thread needs an update soon. Though it is very informative even by now.

Someone should add the heightmaps to the WIKI

OK, fellow Kerbonauts, v0.90 is just around the corner, so let's prepare ourselves for a new survey of the Kerbol system. Prepare your probes, ships and launch vehicles, because this will be the largest survey in the history of KSP. Many new biomes have been added and everything needs to be checked and noted.

OK, fellow Kerbonauts, v0.90 is just around the corner, so let's prepare ourselves for a new survey of the Kerbol system. Prepare your probes, ships and launch vehicles, because this will be the largest survey in the history of KSP. Many new biomes have been added and everything needs to be checked and noted.

Is it just me or did the Maps for the Planets change? Dres looks different and Laythe looks way different.

Edit: Tylo is on the end o the Video.

Edited December 14, 2014 by MalfunctionM1Ke
I wonder if SCANSat will still work ... :-0

I wonder if SCANSat will still work ... :-0

Why wouldn't it? It doesn't really care what the biome map for a planet looks like, only that it exists.

Why wouldn't it? It doesn't really care what the biome map for a planet looks like, only that it exists.

I just want to say thanks for keeping SCANsat up to date. Love that mod.
hmm. With that many biomes, will there be a stock "ScanSat" in the game anytime soon? Mods are fine, but with that new contend, there should be a ingame solution to manage this.

hmm. With that many biomes, will there be a stock "ScanSat" in the game anytime soon? Mods are fine, but with that new contend, there should be a ingame solution to manage this.

Dont think there will be a stock SCANsat but I think also this Mod will be helpfull not to loose track.

v0.9 has been released yesterday. You can't expect this thread will get instantaneous updates as well. It's a collective work of players.

Well, the map view visualization is similar to SCANsat.

New Biomes:

* Added new Biome Maps to all celestial bodies.

* Over a hundred new biomes available in total.

* Added cheat menu option to visualize biomes in map view.

I don't get it.

You get science from researching and sampling the KSC sections.

If you make a Space Program, at least know what you made the Center out of

I don't get it.

You get science from researching and sampling the KSC sections.

If you make a Space Program, at least know what you made the Center out of

That's why it's worth so very little science. It's basically the "baseline" test that everything else is compared to.

That's why it's worth so very little science. It's basically the "baseline" test that everything else is compared to.

I never thought of it that way. It makes sense though- every good scientist should run a control test first

A new data point for you: While I have yet to test this thoroughly, it appears the "KSC" biome has been subdivided into "sub-biomes" for each building. Perhaps an artifact of now having buildings upgradable.

I can confirm that the VAB has its own "biome" with respect to crew reports.

With the help of KSP's cheats to see the biomes, HyperEdit for "fast travel" and MechJeb to see the biome names, I have a list of the different biomes on the planets and moons.

Biomes on Kerbol

  • No biomes

Biomes on Moho

  • North Pole
  • Northern Sinkhole Ridge
  • Northern Sinkhole
  • Highlands
  • Midlands
  • Minor Craters
  • Central Lowlands
  • Western Lowlands
  • South Western Lowlands
  • South Eastern Lowlands
  • Canyon
  • South Pole

Biomes on Eve

  • Poles
  • Explodium Sea
  • Lowlands
  • Midlands
  • Highlands
  • Peaks
  • Impact Ejecta

Biomes on Gilly

  • Lowlands
  • Midlands
  • Highlands

Biomes on Kerbin

  • Ice Caps
  • Tundra
  • Highlands
  • Mountains
  • Grasslands
  • Deserts
  • Badlands
  • Shores
  • Water

Location biomes on Kerbin

  • Administration
  • Astronaut Complex
  • Crawlerway
  • Flag Pole

  • LaunchPad
  • Mission Control
  • R&D
  • R&D Central Building
  • R&D Corner Lab
  • R&D Main Building
  • R&D Observatory
  • R&D Side Lab
  • R&D Small Lab
  • R&D Tanks
  • R&D Wind Tunnel
  • Runway
  • SPH
  • SPH Main Building (Roof)
  • SPH Round Tank
  • SPH Tanks
  • SPH Water Tower
  • Tracking Station
  • Tracking Station Dish East
  • Tracking Station Dish North
  • Tracking Station Dish South
  • Tracking Station Hub
  • VAB
  • VAB Main Building (Roof)
  • VAB Pod Memorial
  • VAB Round Tank
  • VAB Tanks

Biomes on MÃƒÂ¼n

  • Poles
  • Polar Lowlands

  • Highlands

Edited December 19, 2014 by Olympic1
Completed Biomes

sorry if this is covered in another post or another thread, but I've done a bit of searching and haven't quite come up with an answer to the my question (I've seen things in the right direction, just not quite what I was looking for). With all the planets getting biomes does anyone know if there's going to be a way to have like a orbiting satelite perhaps, that can scan for different biomes? like if you were to get it into a polar orbit and just have it reveal the biome as it flys over the planet or something? I know there's some mod's that do something like this, but I'm curious if there'll be something official from Squad? I think it'd be cool to have unmanned satelites used in the game or something along those lines to relay important data. (and then a map overlay to show the location of the different biome)

if this has been answered elseware feel free to delete this post. (though a PM with the location to the answer would be nice as well) thanks!
Since the old "KSC" biome has been divided in seperate biomes for each building, there is a chance that "Old KSC" and "KSC island"also have their own biome. I'll have to check it tomorrow.

That was an amazing bit of research and I thank you for your time, I'll be making great use of it shortly.

One thing of note: The VAB has 2 distinct biomes, 1 on the roof and 1 on the ground. I am fairly certain it is the only building to do this, though it may require testing. If no one checks it out by the weekend I will update.

With all the planets getting biomes does anyone know if there's going to be a way to have like a orbiting satelite perhaps, that can scan for different biomes? like if you were to get it into a polar orbit and just have it reveal the biome as it flys over the planet or something? I know there's some mod's that do something like this, but I'm curious if there'll be something official from Squad? I think it'd be cool to have unmanned satelites used in the game or something along those lines to relay important data. (and then a map overlay to show the location of the different biome)

That was an amazing bit of research and I thank you for your time, I'll be making great use of it shortly.
